introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.text: This web application is used to learn the calculation of probability with normal distributions. The tool includes the following functions.

learn.title: Learning
learn.text: In this part you learn how to calculate probabilities with normal distributions. Interactive diagrams and explanations convey the topic in an understandable and playful way.

application.title: Areas of application
application.text: This part explains example areas in which normal distributions are actually used, how they are used and why they are used.

application.title: Areas of application
application.text: The measured values of many processes in natural science, economics and engineering are approximately normally distributed. The normal distribution is therefore used in many fields to describe data of their probabilities. On this page, two areas are presented in which normal distributions are used.

sections.title: Financial Markets
sections.text: A central task of fund and asset managers is risk management. When trades are executed, a balance must always be struck between return and risk. Both variables are influenced by price fluctuations. It is often assumed that price fluctuations are normally distributed. This allows analysts to calculate the probabilities that certain events will occur. For example, the probability that a security will fall by 10% within the next few days could be calculated. Using historical prices, the mean and standard deviation of price changes can be calculated. By applying the normal distribution and the calculations explained in this application, risks can then be quantified and investment decisions optimized. exercises.text: On this page you will find exercises. The answers can be revealed.

tasks.text: A machine produces 500mm long screws with a standard deviation of 10mm. The length of the screws can be viewed as normally distributed. Calculate the probability that a screw is shorter than 485 mm.

Statisticians estimate that 8% of the population will require medical treatment for the Ebola virus. A wholesaler would like to order treatment materials in advance for pharmacies in a district town with 20,000 inhabitants. The standard deviation is 38. What is the probability that at least 1,350 treatment materials will be required?
A machine produces 500 mm long screws with a standard deviation of 10 mm. Calculate the probability that a screw is no more than 501 mm long and at least 499 mm long.

According to statisticians, 8% of the population will require medical treatment for the Ebola virus. A wholesaler would like to order treatment materials in advance for pharmacies in a district town with 20,000 inhabitants. The standard deviation is 38. What is the probability that the number of treatment materials required does not deviate from the expected value by more than the standard deviation?
